intro: Scandix orientalis, commonly known as the oriental scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found near coastal areas. Scandix orientalis is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
